algorithm_technique: Game theory (Nim game) and pattern recognition of Grundy numbers
problem_summary_simple: Determine the winner of a game where players remove nodes and their subtrees from a Fibonacci tree.
problem_summary_technical: Analyze the game as a Nim game; the winning strategy depends on the Grundy numbers of Fibonacci trees, which exhibit a repeating pattern.
key_insights: This is an impartial game, solvable using the Sprague-Grundy theorem.
The game can be decomposed into subgames corresponding to the left and right subtrees of a node.
The Grundy numbers (or nim-values) of Fibonacci trees follow a specific pattern related to modulo 6.
